lcObjectives.title: Mail basics
lcObjectives.lcObjectivesStem: When you complete this lesson, you'll know how to perform the following mail basics:

lcIntro.p: The intro contains an introduction of the subject following.

p.lines: My bounty is as boundless as the sea,
My love as deep; the more I give to thee,
The more I have, for both are infinite.

lceBox.p: Use the present progressive tense for current action

section.title: Umberto EcoIm Wald der Fiktionen. Sechs Streifzüge durch die Literatur
section.p: Es war einmal … „ein König!“, werden meine lieben Zuhörer sofort sagen. Richtig, diesmal habt ihr’s erraten. Es war einmal der letzte König von Italien, Vittorio Emanuele III., der nach dem Zweiten Weltkrieg ins Exil geschickt wurde. Dieser König stand im Ruf, ein Mann von geringer humanistischer Bildung zu sein, mehr an wirtschaftlichen und militärischen Fragen interessiert, wenn auch ein leidenschaftlicher Sammler alter Münzen. Eines Tages, so wird erzählt, musste er eine Gemäldeausstellung eröffnen und war also gezwungen, durch die Säle zu gehen und die Bilder zu bewundern. Vor einer idyllischen Landschaft, die ein liebliches Tal mit einem Dorf am Berghang zeigte, stand er lange betrachtend, dann fragte er den Direktor der Ausstellung: „Wie viele Einwohner hat dieses Dorf?“

lcQuestion2.p: Draw the points A (2,3) and B (-1, -2) on the given paper.

lceDrawingAnswer.p: Did you draw the x-axis and y-axis?
A (2,3) means the point with x=2 and y=3.

lcQuestion2.p: Identify the missing words in this famous quote from Shakespeare's Richard III.

lceInlineInteractionText.p: Now is the of our discontent
Made glorious by this sun of York;
And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house
In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.

lcQuestion2.p: Do you know the following instrumnets?
Drag and drop the right names to the instruments.

lcIntro.p: The International Air Transport Association assigns three-letter codes to identify airports worldwide. For example, London Heathrow has code LHR.

lcQuestion2.p: Some of the labels on the following diagram are missing: can you fill in the correct three-letter codes for the unlabeled airports?

lceHottext.lcQuestion2: Select the error in the following passage of text (or No Error if there is none).

lceInlineInteractionText.p:
Sponsors of the Olympic Games who bought advertising time on United States television includes
at least a dozen international firms whose names are familiar to American consumers. No error.

lceInlineChoice.lcQuestion2: Choose the missing word in this famous quote from Shakespeare's Richard III.

lceInlineInteractionText.p: Now is the winter of our discontent

Made glorious summer by this sun of
Gloucester
Lancaster
York Right
And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house
In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.

lcFeedbackIncorrect2.p: Wrong. You should read Richard III again.

lcFeedbackCorrect2.p: Good. You know Shakespeare very well.

lceMultipleMatch.lcQuestion2: Match the following characters to the Shakespeare play they appeared in. Draw lines.

learningAssessmentbody.lcIntro: Some people call an user guide "manual".

lcQuestion2.p: Write a manual about a task you choose. Write it in MS Word and upload it.
Follow the pictures clues, fill in the grid, and the arrowed column will reveal a key word related to this scene.
Fill in the crossword puzzle.

lcePuzzleOption.lcePuzzleClue: Small cabbage-like heads or buds growing along a stalk
Long pinkish sour leafstalks usually eaten cooked and sweetened

lcQuestion2.p: Fill in the right form of the verb.

lceInlineInteractionText.p:
This is Mrs White. She
is
(be) a primary school teacher.

She
teachs
(teach) English, Math and Geography.

At the moment she
is teaching
(teach) Math.

lcIntro.p: The number pyramid is built as follows: add two number in one row, which are standing next to each other. The result of this is the number above.

lcQuestion2.p: Fill in the missing numbers.
Look at the figure, there are 5 triangles. Which triangle is equilateral?

lceExplanation.p: A triangle is equilateral when all angles are 60 degrees, triangle A is the only triangle with angles of 60 degrees.

learningAssessmentbody.lcIntro: The lceHotspot is more or less the same as the lcHotspot2 beside that the new LCe element lceExplanation is allowed. That couldn't be added to the lcHotspot2 element because of its tight content model.

lcQuestion2.p: Which of these plantes is Saturn?
Click on it.

lceExplanation.p: The Saturn is different then all other planets. Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter. It is a gas giant. The planet's most famous feature is its prominent ring system, which is composed mostly of ice particles, with a smaller amount of rocky debris and dust. This is the only planet with a ring

lcIntro.p:
Shakespeare’s plays were immediately big hits! He wrote different kinds of plays, all of which could be divided into three categories:
Tragedy – including Hamlet, Othello, King Lear and Romeo and Juliet
Comedy – including Twelfth Night and the The Taming of the Shrew
History – including Henry IV, Henry V and Richard III

lceBox.title: Did you know?
lceBox.p: Plays in Shakespeare’s time were different to the ones we have today. There were no female actors (women’s parts were played by men!), and audiences could be very rowdy. They would shout, boo and even throw food at the actors they didn’t like!

lcQuestion2.p: From which play is this quote:

lq.p: The course of true love never did run smooth.

lcIntro.p: Read this postcard from your English pen-friend, Sam.

lq.p: Here is a postcard of my town. Please send me a postcard from your town. What size is yourtown? What is the nicest part of your town? Where do you go in the evenings? Sam.

lcQuestion2.p: Write Sam a postcard. Answer the questions. Write 25-35 words.

lcOpenAnswer2.p: Hi Sam, in my town are living around 50.000 people. The nicest part is the neighbourhood near to the park. Sometimes I go to a pub in the town center. Dave

lcIntro.p: In the fairy tale "Die Bremer Stadtmusikanten" there are four animals which are get off and sing together.

lcQuestion2.p: In which order does they build their pyramid?
Sort who is standing below and then up to the top.
What is the capital of The Netherlands?

lcIntro.p: Not everything you thought you knew might be true...

lcQuestion2.p: Lightning never strikes in the same place twice.
The top of the Eiffel Tower leans away from the sun.
Twinkies have an infinite shelf life.
